result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Corinthian S Hunter in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel.
States he just started a new job.
BTC: set for another status, needs to fill out PFAC with new work information.
Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any firearms.   Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 03-26-2021: Defendant may be out for confirmed and verified employment
AMENDED 4/18/2022: Defendant may be removed from GPS monitoring.
Status conference on April 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Corinthian S Hunter in court.  Attorney Ashley Castro in court for Corinthian S Hunter. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant is only eligible for SPD on 21CF27. 
Defendant has filed PFAC with the courts.
Court reviews PFAC with defendant. Defendant needs to fill out PFAC with accurate information.
Pretrial services recommends defendant be removed from GPS monitoring. 
State objects to bond modification
BTC: Bond modified to allow defendant to be removed from GPS monitoring
Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report
Status conference on January 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary J Kotleski appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Corinthian S Hunter appeared by video, in custody, Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Corinthian S Hunter. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on January 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
